main event: Three dull-like objects were observed moving in a straight line about two miles apart, with silvery reflections, approximately 20 miles south of Battle Creek, Michigan on June 26, 1960.
interesting points: The objects were described as having no sharp corners and reflecting sunlight,Witnesses reported the objects moving at a very slow rate of speed,One witness identified the objects as helicopters, however, the investigation suggested the objects were typical of known phenomena,The sighting lasted approximately 5 minutes.
sighted object: three dull-like objects in the sky
witness description: One witness described the objects, which were thought to be helicopters.
